section.title: Login
section.para: In order to log into the Tamboti framework, use your cluster username and password. If you click the login button, a pop-up window appears. Your username has to be entered in the following format.
After successful authentication, you can see different options on the interface.
On the left hand side of the Tamboti interface, you find the document collection view.
You can see all the collections which are accessible to you. The collection “mods “ is the root collection.
You have reading access to the grey-colored collections. You have editing access to the bold and black collections.

section.title: Create a collection
section.para: To add a new collection to your home folder, click the button.
After creating the collection, you see the following folder view. When you click on the “collection” it gets selected and marked in blue.
You can see the following action buttons on the top of the collection. From left to right, they allow you to move, delete and edit collections, or to add a new entry.

section.title: Move the collection to another location
section.para: When you click the button, a dialog window will appear, and you can move the collection to any location where you have writing permission.

section.title: Delete the collection
section.para: You can delete an entire collection by clicking the button. Please be aware that the deleted collections cannot be restored.

section.title: Edit permissions
section.para: You can change the permissions to the collections using the collection permissions button. In the first step, you get the collection sharing template.

section.title: Share with a group of cluster members
section.para: If you choose to share with a group, the dialog window expands as follows. You can see the existing group memberships (e.g. publications) and the membership rights.
To add a new group of users who can edit your collection, click on the New Group button.
After you click the Add button, you are redirected to the “collection sharing template”. To see the group “mycollection_editors” in the group menu, click the group sharing button.
You can add the members (e.g. editors) to your group by clicking the Add Member button. A dialog window “Add user to group” pops up:

If you just type the first name of the user , the system automatically suggests you the users. Add any number of users to the group. You can grant the group either reading or writing permissions, or both
A good practice is to name the group according to your work process. Be aware that editing the users in a group is only possible for the group creator!
